result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges, assessments.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
DNA surcharge waived as stated.
Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF5533; consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 12 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in schoool.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Tornado Brewing located at 3506 E. Layton Avenue, Cudahy.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample and surcharge waived as defendant was ordered to provide and pay for surcharges on 14CF5332.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing November 17, 2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF5332  (69 Pages).
Bail Refund Check Packing
11/20/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  18  MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, concurrent with 14CF5533, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 12 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0      
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-DNA sample and surcharges WAIVED as defendant was ordered to provide and pay for surcharges on 14CF5332 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Tornado Brewing located at 3506 E. Layton Avenue, Cudahy 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Copy emailed to State and Defense
From Kelly H. received and filed

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  State requested a Presentence Investigation Report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Telephone call and email received from ADA Joanne Hardtke requesting the currently scheduled plea/sentencing date be rescheduled.  Attorney Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer responds via email that the adjournment to October 14, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. works for his calendar.  AttorneyCimpl-Wiemer will not be able to appear until after 2:30 p.m.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lisa Procaccio leaving for assignment at Children's Court.  Case calendared for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  The Court had to recuse himself due to him knowing the Defendant's mother and grandmother.  The case was reassigned to JUDGE WILLIAM BRASH, BR. #21
Justice Point Pretrial Release Conditions Order; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Justice Point for processing.

Court MODIFIED and INCREASED bail by another $1,000.00 cash for a total cash bail of $$2,500.00 with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (2) Submit to random urine screens.

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a  Warrant Return Hearing.
Court ordered the outstanding bench warrant WITHDRAWN.

Court addressed bail:  Arguments heard.  Court MODIFIED and INCREASED bail by another $1,000.00 cash for a total cash bail of $$2,500.00 with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (2) Submit to random urine screens.  

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 08-25-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Adjourned Plea Hearing.
Justice Point DISCHARGE SUMMARY; filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
No appearances.

Matter in court for a Justice Point Violation Review Hearing.
Court received notice that the defendant received a violation for absconding the office visit after being told to appear in court for testing positive for cocaine and opiates on 06-19-2015.
Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

**No bail forfeited.

Case remains calendared for Plea Hearing on 07-20-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Positive drug screen for opiates and cocaine.)

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Lisa Procaccio is now the attorney of record.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-20-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report with attached Violation Report; received and filed.

Defendant Kyle D Brumirski in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.
Atty. Dluzak moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant; the attorney/client relationship is broken.
No objections.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Dluzak to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in custody.  Deann Heard for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  
Defendant Kyle Dean Brumirski in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
